entry.title: Week 41, 2025: Changelog organization fix merged
entry.content:
Summary

Changelog entry reorganization

Activity

  • Changelog organization improved by Xavier Van de Woestyne who moved a misplaced test suite entry to the correct section (#1975)
entry.summary: Changelog organization fix merged

entry.title: Week 40, 2025: Two releases shipped with new locate-types command, OCaml 5.4 support, and Vim plugin fixes
entry.content:
Summary

OCaml 5.4 support integrated with two releases (5.6-503 and 5.6-504), dependency updates merged, and ongoing work on inlay hints and refactoring

Activity

  • Ulysse shipped two releases this week: 5.6-503 for OCaml 5.3 support branch and 5.6-504 with full OCaml 5.4 support on main, both including the new locate-types command and various fixes (#1973, #1974)
  • Xavier Van de Woestyne upgraded the vendored typer to OCaml 5.4-RC1, preparing the groundwork for full 5.4 support by merging upstream compiler changes (#1971)
  • Liam Stevenson implemented the locate-type-multi query that returns a tree structure representing all type identifiers within complex types, enabling richer IDE navigation for types with arguments (#1951)
  • Tim ats added the -use-typer-cache flag to control typedtree caching behavior, with review feedback leading to clearer naming aligned with existing cache options (#1972)
  • Jules Aguillon fixed a Vim plugin crash caused by out-of-bounds access when gathering text previews for occurrences, improving plugin stability (#1970)
  • Ulysse merged additional short-paths test cases addressing edge cases from previous discussions (#1904)
  • Dependabot updated cachix/install-nix-action from 31.6.1 to 31.7.0, bringing environment variable improvements and updated Nix version (#1969)
  • Marc Lasson has ongoing work on inlay hints handling using [@merlin.hide] attribute instead of ghost locations for more precise control, with Ulysse requesting a rebase for proper review (#1894)
  • Tim ats continues development on expression extraction refactoring command to extract expressions into let bindings, with active collaboration from Ulysse on implementation details (#1948)
entry.summary: Two releases shipped with new locate-types command, OCaml 5.4 support, and Vim plugin fixes

entry.title: Week 39, 2025: Benchmarking infrastructure added with timing tests for Merlin operations on large files, plus ongoing refactoring work
entry.content:
Summary

Major refactoring initiative for expression extraction ongoing, with dependency updates and merged benchmarking work

Activity

  • Major refactoring feature opened by Tim ats adding new command to extract expressions into fresh let bindings with comprehensive implementation across 17 files (#1948)
  • Benchmarking work completed by Xavier Van de Woestyne with two merged PRs adding timing tests for Merlin domains and large file operations (#1967, #1968)
  • Dependency maintenance with Dependabot updating Nix action from 31.6.1 to 31.6.2 (#1966)
entry.summary: Benchmarking infrastructure added with timing tests for Merlin operations on large files, plus ongoing refactoring work

entry.title: Week 38, 2025: Issue activity focused on dune executable naming conflicts and LSP error discrepancies, with ongoing PR development for enhanced type location features
entry.content:
Summary

One new issue opened regarding error discrepancies, with ongoing development on two significant PRs for type location and expression extraction features

Activity

  • Raoul Hidalgo Charman opened new issue about error discrepancy between dune build and ocaml-lsp (#1965), initially reported in ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1543
  • Type location enhancement PR by Liam Stevenson continues development with recent updates for locate_type_multi query to support complex type navigation in VSCode (#1951)
  • Expression extraction refactoring PR by Tim ats progressing with updates for new command to extract expressions into let bindings (#1948)
  • Ongoing library information issue with @yannl35133 receiving community feedback about dune executable name prefix conflicts affecting library access (#1867)
entry.summary: Issue activity focused on dune executable naming conflicts and LSP error discrepancies, with ongoing PR development for enhanced type location features

entry.title: Week 37, 2025: Type recovery improvements for mutual recursive definitions and OpenBSD compatibility fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Multiple type recovery improvements merged and ongoing locatetypemulti feature development

Activity

  • Type recovery enhancements merged by Ulysse addressing Thomas Refis's issue with recursive definitions dropping entire blocks (#1962, #1963) plus OpenBSD compatibility merged from @omegametabroccolo (#1956)
  • CI dependency updates completed with Dependabot merging updates to actions/checkout v5, actions/download-artifact v5, and cachix/install-nix-action v31.6.1 (#1957, #1955, #1961)
  • Advanced type location query under development by Liam Stevenson for VSCode integration with locate_type_multi command that returns tree structure of all identifiers within a type (#1951)
  • Parallel typing experiment discussion continuing on typer domain implementation by Carine Morel exploring concurrent typing computations (#1890)
entry.summary: Type recovery improvements for mutual recursive definitions and OpenBSD compatibility fixes

entry.title: Week 36, 2025: Limited activity with one new Dependabot PR opened for dependency updates
entry.content:
Summary

One new dependency update PR opened by Dependabot while ongoing type query enhancement PR continues development

Activity

  • Dependabot opened dependency update PR to bump cachix/install-nix-action from 31.3.0 to 31.6.0 (#1960)
  • Liam Stevenson continues developing type query enhancement with locate_type_multi command for VSCode integration (#1951)
entry.summary: Limited activity with one new Dependabot PR opened for dependency updates

entry.title: Week 35, 2025: Major typer interruption system merged and new locate-types command added for enhanced type navigation
entry.content:
Summary

Typer interruption feature merged after extensive development, with one refactoring PR closed without merging

Activity

  • Typer interruption system by Xavier Van de Woestyne merged after extensive development work, implementing comprehensive changes across typing infrastructure, analysis modules, and test coverage with 58,503 additions (#1920)
  • DocumentSymbol feature request for query availability resolved and closed as implemented (#1902)
  • Protocol refactoring PR by Liam Stevenson closed without merging due to concerns about introducing ppx dependencies and complexity (#1952)
entry.summary: Major typer interruption system merged and new locate-types command added for enhanced type navigation

entry.title: Week 34, 2025: PR opened for GitHub Actions update while existing typer interruption work progressed with domain rebasing attempts
entry.content:
Summary

Dependabot PR for GitHub Actions update opened, with two failed attempts to rebase merlin-domains for typer interruption work

Activity

  • Dependabot opened GitHub Actions update PR to bump actions/checkout from version 4 to 5 (#1957)
  • Xavier Van de Woestyne made two attempts to rebase merlin-domains branch, both closed due to conflicts, preparing for typer interruption PR (#1958, #1959)
  • Ongoing type location enhancement work by Liam Stevenson with new locate_type_multi query for improved VSCode integration (#1951)
  • OpenBSD compatibility fix by @omegametabroccolo for merlin_reader functionality awaiting merge (#1956)
  • Typer interruption feature by Xavier Van de Woestyne continuing development after domain rebasing (#1920)
entry.summary: PR opened for GitHub Actions update while existing typer interruption work progressed with domain rebasing attempts

entry.title: Week 33, 2025: Two new PRs opened for OpenBSD compatibility and dependency updates
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened addressing OpenBSD compatibility and CI dependency updates

Activity

  • Two new PRs opened during the week: OpenBSD merlin_reader fix by @omegametabroccolo addressing execve(2) requirements (#1956) and GitHub Actions dependency update by Dependabot bumping actions/download-artifact from v4 to v5 (#1955)
  • Issue activity on long-standing toplevel directives bug reported by Daniel BÃ¼nzli with community member providing compatibility feedback (#1023)
entry.summary: Two new PRs opened for OpenBSD compatibility and dependency updates

entry.title: Week 32, 2025: None
entry.content: Activity report for ocaml/merlin - Week 32, 2025
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml/merlin - Week 32, 2025

entry.title: Week 31, 2025: Dependency update automation and ongoing locate-type-multi API development
entry.content:
Summary

One new dependency update PR and ongoing discussion about PPX usage for type location API

Activity

  • New dependency update PR opened by Dependabot to bump cachix/install-nix-action from 31.3.0 to 31.5.2 (#1954)
  • Ongoing locate-type-multi API development by Liam Stevenson with continued discussion about PPX dependencies for new VSCode functionality (#1951)
  • Previous dependency update completed with closure of earlier cachix/install-nix-action bump PR (#1950)
entry.summary: Dependency update automation and ongoing locate-type-multi API development

entry.title: Week 30, 2025: New expression extraction and type location commands proposed with architecture discussions
entry.content:
Summary

Two major PRs opened for refactoring features plus issue report on type recovery limitations

Activity

  • Expression extraction refactoring command introduced by Tim ats to generate let bindings from selected expressions (#1948), implementing string-based substitution with manual location calculations and awaiting additional testing
  • Multi-type location query feature proposed by Liam Stevenson for VSCode integration (#1951), returning tree structures of type identifiers for complex types like a -> (b * c) with extensive discussions on dependency choices and LSP compatibility
  • Type protocol refactoring PR opened by Liam Stevenson to move definitions into query_protocol_kernel for jsofocaml compatibility (#1952), introducing ppx dependencies and aligning with oxcaml/merlin fork requirements
entry.summary: New expression extraction and type location commands proposed with architecture discussions

entry.title: Week 29, 2025: Dependabot closed two security update PRs for Nix action dependencies
entry.content:
Summary

One Dependabot PR opened, one closed; ongoing discussion on extract-expression refactoring feature

Activity

  • Dependency security update opened by Dependabot to bump cachix/install-nix-action from 31.3.0 to 31.5.1 (#1950)
  • Earlier dependency update closed by Dependabot bumping cachix/install-nix-action from 31.3.0 to 31.4.1 (#1946)
  • Ongoing refactoring feature development with active discussion on extract-expression functionality between Tim ats and Xavier Van de Woestyne covering implementation approach, error handling, and free variable analysis (#1948)
entry.summary: Dependabot closed two security update PRs for Nix action dependencies

entry.title: Week 28, 2025: Long-standing refactor-open bug closed and ongoing custom operator location improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Ongoing improvement to custom operator locations in PR and closure of 7-year-old refactor-open bug

Activity

  • Long-standing refactor-open bug from 2018 was closed by NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r involving incorrect variable scope handling when refactoring let open statements (#808)
  • Custom operator location improvements continue in ongoing PR by Brian Ward targeting better location detection for operators like := and custom indexing operations (#1917)
entry.summary: Long-standing refactor-open bug closed and ongoing custom operator location improvements

entry.title: Week 27, 2025: New refactoring command for expression extraction and vim integration improvements discussed
entry.content:
Summary

New refactoring PR opened and vim integration issue resolved through community support

Activity

  • Refactoring capabilities extended with new expression extraction command by Tim ats adding refactoring-extract-region to merlin protocol (#1948)
  • OCaml 5.4 upgrade work continues with Ulysse providing debugging guidance for recovery issues during compiler version transitions (#1938)
  • Dependency maintenance handled automatically with Dependabot managing cachix/install-nix-action updates for CI infrastructure (#1946, #1939)
entry.summary: New refactoring command for expression extraction and vim integration improvements discussed

entry.title: Week 26, 2025: Major release week featuring outline selection improvements, destruct hang fixes, and locate issue resolutions
entry.content:
Summary

Release preparation dominated the week with version 5.5-503 shipped along with comprehensive bug fixes and testing improvements

Activity

  • Release 5.5-503 completed by Ulysse including comprehensive changelog updates and version preparation (#1945)
  • Outline API enhancement merged with new selection field functionality to improve LSP compatibility and editor experience (#1942, #1943)
  • Locate functionality fixes addressing multiple long-standing issues with jump-to-definition failures in various scenarios (#1930)
  • Destruct command stabilization with fix for infinite loop when processing certain pattern constructs (#1944)
  • Test case additions for reproducing parsing issues with := and custom indexing operators by Brian Ward (#1916)
  • 4.19-414 backport release completed with selected features backported to the 4.19 branch (#1940)
entry.summary: Major release week featuring outline selection improvements, destruct hang fixes, and locate issue resolutions

entry.title: Week 25, 2025: None
entry.content:
Summary

Technical discussion on jump-to-definition bug when multiple files share the same name

Activity

  • Location resolution issue discussion continued on bug where jumping to Core.Md5 fails with "Several source files in your path have the same name" error reported by Dani Dickstein (#1934)
  • Technical solutions proposed by Liam Stevenson to extend existing heuristics from PR #1882 to handle cases where no files have matching digests, suggesting score_file heuristic improvements
  • Build system integration discussion by Rudi Grinberg addressing BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP mangling issues affecting both Merlin and ocamldebug, with Jane Street planning build rule changes to record relative paths from project root
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml/merlin - Week 25, 2025

entry.title: Week 24, 2025: Single PR opened for OCaml 4.14/4.19 backports by Ulysse
entry.content:
Summary

OCaml 4.14/4.19 backports PR opened by Ulysse during week

Activity

  • OCaml version compatibility work initiated by Ulysse with new PR for 4.14 and 4.19 backports (#1940)
entry.summary: Single PR opened for OCaml 4.14/4.19 backports by Ulysse

entry.title: Week 23, 2025: Minimal activity with only one dependency update PR opened by Dependabot
entry.content:
Summary

Single dependency update PR opened for Nix action version bump

Activity

  • Dependency update opened by Dependabot to bump cachix/install-nix-action from 31.3.0 to 31.4.0, bringing Nix 2.29.0 and automated CI updates (#1939)
entry.summary: Minimal activity with only one dependency update PR opened by Dependabot

entry.title: Week 22, 2025: Four PRs merged focusing on bug fixes and infrastructure improvements.
entry.content:
Summary

Merged four PRs including two bug fixes, one infrastructure update, and upstream changes integration.

Activity

  • Short-paths graph bug fix by Ulysse resolved assertion errors affecting users with large OCaml files by preventing duplicate type definitions in the graph and downstreaming upstream typer fixes (#1935)
  • Outline improvement by Tim ats enhanced IDE code navigation by properly handling object expressions nested inside let bindings, with code refinements by Ulysse (#1936)
  • Infrastructure update merged dependency upgrade for Nix action from V28 to 31.3.0 via Dependabot (#1931)
  • Upstream integration by Carine Morel brought merlin-domains branch changes into main, removing pipeline laziness and updating related functionality (#1909)
  • Issue #1913 reported by Mike Shulman was closed after resolution through the short-paths graph fix
entry.summary: Four PRs merged focusing on bug fixes and infrastructure improvements.

entry.title: Week 21, 2025: OCaml outline feature improvements merged and OCaml 5.4 compatibility issues addressed
entry.content:
Summary

Fix for short path issue merged and OCaml 5.4 compatibility work initiated by main maintainer

Activity

  • OCaml 5.4 upgrade opened by Ulysse to address compiler version compatibility issues reported by Kate (#1938, #1937)
  • Short path issue fix completed and merged by Ulysse after extensive testing with user feedback (#1935)
  • Test coverage expanded for outline generation in interface files by Tim ats (#1933)
entry.summary: OCaml outline feature improvements merged and OCaml 5.4 compatibility issues addressed

entry.title: Week 20, 2025: Two PRs merged improving outline functionality and fixing OCaml 5.3 compatibility
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened including extract region refactoring and domains rebasing work

Activity

  • New PR opened for expression extraction into let bindings by Tim ats with comprehensive refactoring command implementation (#1948)
  • Domains rebasing work opened by Xavier Van de Woestyne but quickly closed due to conflicts, needed for ongoing parallelization efforts (#1958)
  • OCaml 5.3 fix merged by Ulysse addressing short path resolution issues in type constructor annotations (#1935)
  • Outline improvements merged by Tim ats enabling better object expression handling in let bindings for LSP integration (#1936)
entry.summary: Two PRs merged improving outline functionality and fixing OCaml 5.3 compatibility

entry.title: Week 19, 2025: Improved outline functionality with class type support and comprehensive test coverage added
entry.content:
Summary

Class type outline improvements merged with extensive testing and dependency updates processed

Activity

  • Class type outline handling completed by Tim ats with comprehensive implementation fixing outline generation for class type declarations (#1932)
  • Testing infrastructure enhanced with new test cases for outline generation in .mli files, covering class types, modules, and various OCaml constructs (#1933)
  • Dependency maintenance handled with Nix action updates from Dependabot bumping cachix/install-nix-action from V28 to 31.3.0 (#1931)
  • Bug reproduction efforts continued with locate issue testing by Ulysse for various typing recovery problems (#1930)
entry.summary: Improved outline functionality with class type support and comprehensive test coverage added

entry.title: Week 18, 2025: OCaml 5.04 compatibility improvements with bug fixes and test updates
entry.content:
Summary

OCaml 5.04 compatibility updates with two new issues opened and one PR merged

Activity

  • Two new bug reports opened including Liam Stevenson reporting incorrect jump-to-definition behavior with record field punning (#1929) and Dani Dickstein identifying signature help failures with type aliases (#1927)
  • OCaml 5.04 compatibility work completed with Ulysse merging the 504 preview PR (#1928) and making follow-up improvements to warning handling and build configuration
  • Ongoing locate issues continue receiving attention with Ulysse analyzing root causes for various jump-to-definition problems including opam-monorepo conflicts (#1821) and type location errors (#1594)
  • Graph.add error investigation remains active with Mike Shulman and Ulysse working to reproduce and debug the "type already defined" crash affecting OCaml 5.3.0 users (#1913)
entry.summary: OCaml 5.04 compatibility improvements with bug fixes and test updates

entry.title: Week 17, 2025: Feature request for visual hints to distinguish exported functions and dependency update activities
entry.content:
Summary

Two dependency update PRs closed without merging and one feature request opened

Activity

  • Dependency updates were attempted by Dependabot with two PRs for cachix/install-nix-action upgrades (#1925, #1922), both closed without merging
  • Feature request opened by Nicolas Despres for visual hints to distinguish exported functions in module signatures (#1926)
entry.summary: Feature request for visual hints to distinguish exported functions and dependency update activities

entry.title: Week 16, 2025: Bug fixes for renaming functionality merged with identifier validation and Lid comparison improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Single PR merged addressing core renaming bugs with extensive test updates

Activity

  • Renaming functionality fixes merged by Ulysse with comprehensive improvements to identifier filtering and Lid comparison (#1924)
  • Test suite updates across multiple project-wide occurrence tests to reflect the improved ordering and behavior from the bug fixes
  • CI workflow improvement with updated ocaml-lsp compatibility check configuration
entry.summary: Bug fixes for renaming functionality merged with identifier validation and Lid comparison improvements

entry.title: Week 15, 2025: Inlay hints for function parameters fixed and merged, with dependency updates and active documentation discussions
entry.content:
Summary

One enhancement PR merged with dependency management PRs being superseded

Activity

  • Inlay hints enhancement merged by Xavier Van de Woestyne fixing function parameter hints that were broken since function argument representation changes (#1923)
  • Dependency update PRs from Dependabot for cachix/install-nix-action bumping from V28 to 31.1.0, with newer PR #1922 superseding #1911
entry.summary: Inlay hints for function parameters fixed and merged, with dependency updates and active documentation discussions

entry.title: Week 14, 2025: Active week with new custom operator location issues, test additions, and typer interruption work
entry.content:
Summary

Four new PRs opened focusing on custom operators and typer interruption, plus ongoing type alias display improvements

Activity

  • Four new PRs opened this week including typer interruption implementation by Xavier Van de Woestyne (#1920, #1919), custom operator location fix by Brian Ward (#1917), and reproducing test addition (#1916)
  • Custom operator support improvements with Brian Ward addressing go-to-definition issues for := and custom indexing operators, providing both reproducing tests and potential fixes for identifier reconstruction (#1915, #1916, #1917)
  • Type alias display issue reported by NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r regarding type aliases "polluting" expression types, with discussion about ongoing short-paths feature rewrite (#1918)
  • Major typer interruption work by Xavier Van de Woestyne building on merlin-domains branch (#1909) with extensive changes across 67 files adding 58K+ lines of code (#1920)
entry.summary: Active week with new custom operator location issues, test additions, and typer interruption work

entry.title: Week 13, 2025: Three new issues opened covering typing errors, go-to-definition bugs, and Neovim setup problems
entry.content:
Summary

Three new issues opened addressing typing errors, operator navigation, and editor integration

Activity

  • Typing error investigation opened by Mike Shulman reporting "Graph.add: type already defined" errors causing merlin to stop working entirely in large files (#1913)
  • Go-to-definition enhancement requested by Brian Ward for custom operators, which currently don't support navigation to definitions, affecting DSL usability (#1915)
  • Neovim integration issue reported by Yihang "Corvo" Liu with NixOS setup showing "Key not present in Dictionary: ocamlmerlin_path" errors in the Python integration (#1914)
entry.summary: Three new issues opened covering typing errors, go-to-definition bugs, and Neovim setup problems

entry.title: Week 12, 2025: Issue opened about duplicated open flags and dependabot PR for nix action update
entry.content:
Summary

New issue opened about build configuration and dependabot dependency update PR

Activity

  • Build configuration issue opened by Mathieu Barbin reporting duplicated -open flags in dune files discovered while testing dunolint tool (#1912)
  • Dependency update PR opened by Dependabot to bump cachix/install-nix-action from V28 to 31 (#1911)
entry.summary: Issue opened about duplicated open flags and dependabot PR for nix action update

entry.title: Week 11, 2025: Two PRs opened for merlin-domains branch upstreaming work and one ppx_deriving issue reported
entry.content:
Summary

Two PRs opened for merlin-domains upstreaming work and one issue reported for ppx_deriving function location

Activity

  • Merlin-domains upstreaming work initiated by Xavier Van de Woestyne opening initial PR (#1908) which was then superseded by Carine Morel with improved implementation (#1909)
  • PPX integration issue reported by @arvidj where Merlin cannot locate functions generated by ppx_deriving (#1910), affecting "Jump to definition" functionality in editors like Emacs
entry.summary: Two PRs opened for merlin-domains branch upstreaming work and one ppx_deriving issue reported

entry.title: Week 10, 2025: Infrastructure improvements focused on CI enhancements, package maintenance, and test suite expansion
entry.content:
Summary

One new PR opened for inlay hints improvements, plus multiple infrastructure merges and issue resolutions

Activity

  • Inlay hints enhancement opened by Marc Lasson to improve handling with [@merlin.hide] attribute, replacing ghost location logic (#1894)
  • Infrastructure improvements completed with Xavier Van de Woestyne merging CI enhancements for merl-an benchmarking (#1896, #1905, #1906, #1907)
  • Package maintenance completed by Ulysse adding maintenance intent fields and test case for open ordering issue (#1903, #1901)
  • Issue resolutions including closure of locate error bug (#1592) and maintenance intent request (#1879)
entry.summary: Infrastructure improvements focused on CI enhancements, package maintenance, and test suite expansion

entry.title: Week 9, 2025: Occurrences command enhanced with stale file reporting and bug fixes, plus ongoing typer domain work
entry.content:
Summary

New feature request for DocumentSymbol support, bug report on module opening order, and ongoing typer domain development

Activity

  • New feature request opened by Xavier Van de Woestyne for DocumentSymbol/Outlines functionality to be moved from ocaml-lsp-server into Merlin as a query (#1902)
  • Module opening order bug reported by JÃ©rÃ´me Vouillon with comprehensive reproduction case, where Dune and Merlin handle module opens differently (#1900)
  • Test case added by Ulysse to illustrate the module opening order issue and linked to proposed Dune fix (#1901)
  • Typer domain experiment continues with Carine Morel leading development of concurrent typing architecture, though marked as draft due to ongoing exception handling issues (#1890)
entry.summary: Occurrences command enhanced with stale file reporting and bug fixes, plus ongoing typer domain work

entry.title: Week 8, 2025: Minor infrastructure updates including Nix build fix and test cleanup during OCaml 5.03 integration work
entry.content:
Summary

Infrastructure maintenance with Nix build dependencies and test formatting updates alongside documentation planning

Activity

  • Build system improvements by Xavier Van de Woestyne including alcotest dependency addition for Nix builds (#1897) and test formatting fix to resolve escape sequence issues (#1899)
  • Documentation modernization proposed through README rework initiative to remove outdated links and improve project setup documentation (#1898)
  • Configuration analysis reported for module opening order inconsistency between Merlin and Dune affecting Wasm_of_ocaml_compiler builds (#1900)
  • Upcoming code formatting work in progress with merl-an application being prepared for main branch integration (#1896)
entry.summary: Minor infrastructure updates including Nix build fix and test cleanup during OCaml 5.03 integration work

entry.title: Week 7, 2025: One discussion about global typechecking opened by NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r exploring whole-project analysis capabilities
entry.content:
Summary

Single issue opened discussing global typechecking architecture with minimal PR activity

Activity

  • NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r opened discussion about global typechecking capabilities, exploring how Merlin could perform whole-project analysis similar to Rust analyzer instead of file-by-file typechecking (#1895)
  • Minor activity on Xavier Van de Woestyne's previously merged OCaml 5.3.0 support PR with a small update (#1850)
entry.summary: One discussion about global typechecking opened by NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r exploring whole-project analysis capabilities

entry.title: Week 6, 2025: Major ocaml-index performance improvement with granular marshalling and improvements to inlay hints handling merged.
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened for inlay hints improvements while ongoing work continues on jump target optimization.

Activity

  • New inlay hints improvements opened by Marc Lasson including enhanced [@merlin.hide] attribute handling (#1894) and initial ghost location traversal work (#1892)
  • Jump command optimization continues with PixieDust implementing get_all function to return all possible jump targets in a single query, reducing client-server round trips (#1891)
  • Maintenance discussions around opam package archival policy with Hannes Mehnert addressing x-maintenance-intent field requirements (#1879)
  • License clarification raised by @MSoegtropIMC regarding inconsistencies between top-level MIT license and LGPL headers in some source files (#1893)
entry.summary: Major ocaml-index performance improvement with granular marshalling and improvements to inlay hints handling merged.

entry.title: Week 5, 2025: Two PRs merged including locate disambiguation improvements and typed-holes API enhancements.
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened for typer domain experimentation and jump targets functionality, plus package archival discussions.

Activity

  • Experimental typer domain implementation opened by Carine Morel for concurrent typing computations with partial results and interruption handling (#1890)
  • Jump targets enhancement opened by PixieDust adding get_all function to retrieve all possible jump targets in one server trip (#1891)
  • Package maintenance discussion between Hannes Mehnert and Ulysse regarding opam repository archival policy and x-maintenance-intent field specification (#1879)
  • Global API search inquiry from Noah Bogart about Dune support integration following merged upstream changes (#61)
entry.summary: Two PRs merged including locate disambiguation improvements and typed-holes API enhancements.

entry.title: Week 4, 2025: None
entry.content:
Summary

Project-wide occurrences tracker issue received an update with progress tracking

Activity

  • Project-wide occurrences tracker issue received updates during the week as Ulysse continued tracking progress on this major feature initiative (#1780)
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml/merlin - Week 4, 2025

entry.title: Week 3, 2025: Typed holes compatibility improvements and ocaml-index performance optimization work continued
entry.content:
Summary

Three new PRs opened including granular marshal performance optimization, while one compatibility PR merged

Activity

  • New granular marshal PR opened by Ulysse for replacing Marshal with Granular_marshal in ocaml-index to improve performance on large projects (#1889)
  • Typed hole compatibility work merged by Liam Stevenson addressing constructor naming conflicts with ocaml-flambda backend (#1888)
  • Index package maintenance completed by Ulysse with magic number bump and opam package update, including new release v5.4.1-503 (#1886)
  • Previous granular marshal PR closed by CharlÃ¨ne_Gros and superseded by the new implementation (#1875)
entry.summary: Typed holes compatibility improvements and ocaml-index performance optimization work continued

entry.title: Week 2, 2025: Major OCaml 5.3 support release with project-wide renaming and locate improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Released Merlin 5.4-503 with comprehensive OCaml 5.3 support and enhanced project navigation features

Activity

  • OCaml 5.3 compatibility completed by Ulysse with final upstream changes integration and continuation pattern fixes (#1880)
  • Release 5.4-503 published by Ulysse including all OCaml 5.3 features and project-wide renaming capabilities (#1883)
  • Advanced locate features merged by Liam Stevenson improving file disambiguation and stale occurrence handling (#1882, #1885)
  • Granular marshal optimization for ocaml-index performance discussed but closed without merge, focusing on lazy loading for large projects (#1875)
entry.summary: Major OCaml 5.3 support release with project-wide renaming and locate improvements

entry.title: Week 1, 2025: None
entry.content: Activity report for ocaml/merlin - Week 1, 2025
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml/merlin - Week 1, 2025

entry.title: Week 52, 2024: None
entry.content: Activity report for ocaml/merlin - Week 52, 2024
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml/merlin - Week 52, 2024

entry.title: Week 51, 2024: Major improvements to locate behavior using OCaml 5.3 features, plus new Emacs locate shortcut request
entry.content:
Summary

Multiple PRs merged improving locate behavior and index performance, plus new feature requests for Emacs integration

Activity

  • OCaml 5.3 integration completed with Ulysse merging source information improvements (#1857) and Printtyp changes (#1876) to enhance locate accuracy and resolve interface/implementation confusion
  • Project-wide renaming reached production readiness through Ulysse implementing union-find structures for aggregating linked declarations during indexing (#1877)
  • Performance optimization work ongoing with CharlÃ¨ne_Gros developing granular marshal replacement for ocaml-index to improve search performance on large projects (#1875)
  • Configuration flexibility proposed by @jonahbeckford with .merlin.skip-if-not-cwd mechanism for complex project setups (#1870)
  • Bug reports submitted including short-paths handling issues with open statements (#1873) and filename path handling questions (#1871)
entry.summary: Major improvements to locate behavior using OCaml 5.3 features, plus new Emacs locate shortcut request

entry.title: Week 50, 2024: Major OCaml 5.3 support integration and Vim plugin enhancements for search-by-type functionality
entry.content:
Summary

Completed major OCaml 5.3 integration, enhanced Vim plugin search capabilities, and addressed test fixes and formatting updates

Activity

  • OCaml 5.3 support delivered through extensive compiler integration by Xavier Van de Woestyne with 106,000+ additions across 382 files covering lexer, parser, type system, and error reporting updates (#1850)
  • Search-by-type capabilities implemented for Vim plugin by Jules Aguillon enabling type-based queries through enhanced :MerlinSearch command with automatic detection of polarity vs type search (#1846)
  • File navigation enhancements merged by Ulysse using OCaml 5.3's uid source information for improved locate functionality between interface and implementation files (#1857)
  • Type printing fixes applied by Ulysse to restore short-paths functionality and improve type declaration display using manifest information (#1876)
  • Test infrastructure updates including implicit transitive dependency test fixes (#1874) and new test case for Dune copy issues (#1872)
  • Code formatting upgrades with OCamlformat 0.27.0 integration and CI workflow updates for improved development experience (b950681)
entry.summary: Major OCaml 5.3 support integration and Vim plugin enhancements for search-by-type functionality

entry.title: Week 49, 2024: New issue about PPX filename handling and test PR for go-to-definition issue opened during quiet development week
entry.content:
Summary

New issue on PPX filename handling and test PR for go-to-definition bug added to track existing issue

Activity

  • New issue opened by @jonahbeckford questioning why Merlin uses basename instead of full path for Location.input_name in PPX processing, affecting Java-like packaging systems (#1871)
  • Test PR opened by Ulysse to illustrate the go-to-definition failure with copied sources from Dune, providing reproducible test case for existing bug (#1872)
  • Ongoing short-paths bug discussion in #1643 with Richard Eisenberg reporting incorrect type path display and Ulysse investigating potential fixes
  • Go-to-definition issue remains open with prometheansacrifice reporting LSP failures when symbols are from copied sources in vendored code (#1842)
entry.summary: New issue about PPX filename handling and test PR for go-to-definition issue opened during quiet development week

entry.title: Week 48, 2024: Merlin 5.3 release week with bug fixes for type-enclosing stability and occurrences handling plus new configuration features
entry.content:
Summary

Release preparation activities with backporting and new configuration features proposed for .merlin file handling

Activity

  • New configuration feature proposed by @jonahbeckford introducing .merlin.skip-if-not-cwd files to control configuration loading in subprojects (#1870)
  • Release activities by Ulysse including backports for 4.18-414 release (#1866) and release preparation for merlin 5.3 (ac951c6)
  • Bug fix integration completed with type-enclosing deduplication fixes (#1864) and occurrences improvements (#1865) merged into main branch
  • Test case development by Ulysse creating reproduction test for executable name prefix configuration bug (#1868)
entry.summary: Merlin 5.3 release week with bug fixes for type-enclosing stability and occurrences handling plus new configuration features

entry.title: Week 47, 2024: Two critical bug fixes merged: jump-to-function crash and type enclosing deduplication improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Focused bug fixing week with two major fixes merged by primary maintainer

Activity

  • Bug resolution completed with Ulysse merging fix for jump-to-function assertion failure that was crashing LSP server (#1863, fixes #1862)
  • Performance improvement delivered through type enclosing deduplication refactoring by Ulysse with code review discussion from Xavier Van de Woestyne (#1864)
  • Issue closure of jump crash bug reported with detailed backtrace and LSP server error information (#1862)
entry.summary: Two critical bug fixes merged: jump-to-function crash and type enclosing deduplication improvements

entry.title: Week 46, 2024: None
entry.content: Activity report for ocaml/merlin - Week 46, 2024
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml/merlin - Week 46, 2024

entry.title: Week 45, 2024: Documentation update added changelog entry for jump-to-fun fix
entry.content:
Summary

Ongoing PR for jump-to-fun bug fix with changelog documentation

Activity

  • Jump-to-fun fix documentation completed by Ulysse with changelog entry added for the bug fix addressing issues after OCaml 5.2 upgrade (#1863)
entry.summary: Documentation update added changelog entry for jump-to-fun fix

entry.title: Week 44, 2024: Jump functionality bug fix for OCaml 5.2 compatibility and OCamlformat upgrade preview
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened: OCamlformat 0.27.0 upgrade preview and bug fix for jump functionality

Activity

  • OCamlformat 0.27.0 upgrade preview opened by Jules Aguillon to gather community feedback (#1861) with discussion about formatting behavior changes
  • Jump functionality fix implemented and merged by Ulysse addressing crash after OCaml 5.2 upgrade (#1863) resolving assertion failure in src/analysis/jump.ml
entry.summary: Jump functionality bug fix for OCaml 5.2 compatibility and OCamlformat upgrade preview

entry.title: Week 43, 2024: Bug fix for polarity search exception and improved documentation for search-by-polarity command
entry.content:
Summary

One PR merged fixing long-standing polarity search bug and opening follow-up improvement issue

Activity

  • Polarity search bug resolution by Xavier Van de Woestyne fixing 4-year-old Not_found exception from polarity search functionality (#1858, #1113)
  • Search-by-type cost computation improvement opened by Xavier Van de Woestyne addressing over-permissive scoring for string-like terms in type search (#1859)
entry.summary: Bug fix for polarity search exception and improved documentation for search-by-polarity command

entry.title: Week 42, 2024: One new PR opened introducing improvements to file jumping and occurrence detection for OCaml 5.3
entry.content:
Summary

New PR opened for enhanced source file navigation and ongoing development of OCaml 5.3 support and search functionality

Activity

  • File navigation improvements opened by Ulysse to enhance source information handling in OCaml 5.3, enabling better jumping to interface files and providing occurrences in both interface and implementation files (#1857)
  • OCaml 5.3 compatibility work by Xavier Van de Woestyne continuing with major version support additions (#1850)
  • Search-by-type functionality development previously completed by Xavier Van de Woestyne, introducing Sherlodoc-like capabilities for type-based search in Merlin (#1828)
entry.summary: One new PR opened introducing improvements to file jumping and occurrence detection for OCaml 5.3

entry.title: Week 41, 2024: Bug fixes for path resolution in occurrences and packaging improvements merged this week
entry.content: Activity report for ocaml/merlin - Week 41, 2024
entry.summary: Bug fixes for path resolution in occurrences and packaging improvements merged this week
